TITLE: Golf at 3 p.m. Thursday? Sure, It’s the Afternoon Fun Economy.
SUMMARY: Remote workers have fueled a surge in weekday exercise, cosmetics and leisure — especially at the driving range.

TITLE: The New Prime Time for TV News: Afternoons
SUMMARY: The biggest draw on Fox News is no longer Tucker Carlson or Sean Hannity; it’s “The Five.” And daytime shows on CNN and MSNBC are outranking evening programming.

TITLE: Live Updates: Yellen Says Regulators ‘Resolute’ in Protecting Bank Customers
SUMMARY: The Treasury secretary, testifying before members of the Senate, says the country’s banking system “remains sound.” Stocks were volatile in the United States, with pressure on midsize banks. The European Central Bank raised interest rates by half a point as fears of inflation overcame financial industry worries.

TITLE: China Wine Tariff Pushes Australia’s Grape Growers Into Crisis
SUMMARY: Two years later, they’re suffering from a glut of red wine and plummeting grape prices with no overseas market big enough to fill the gap.

TITLE: Credit Suisse to Borrow Up to $54 Billion From Central Bank
SUMMARY: The announcement came after investors, fearing that the bank would run out of money, began dumping its stock.

TITLE: Stock Markets Fall as Bank Shares Take a Beating
SUMMARY: Stomach-churning volatility in stocks, bonds and other assets on Wednesday reflected renewed worries about the state of the economy and the risks lurking in the financial system.

TITLE: UK Budget Offers More Free Child Care as Work Incentive
SUMMARY: In a major policy speech, Jeremy Hunt, the chancellor of the Exchequer, offered plans to promote greater work force participation, including more free child care.

TITLE: After SVB Collapse, Fed and Lawmakers Eye Bank Rules
SUMMARY: The stunning demise of Silicon Valley Bank has spurred soul-searching about how large and regional banks are overseen.

TITLE: U.K. Bans TikTok on Government Devices
SUMMARY: The move reflects fears in Britain and elsewhere in the West that the popular app’s Chinese ownership could share user information with Beijing.

TITLE: First Republic Bank Is Said to Be Exploring a Potential Sale
SUMMARY: With its shares getting pummeled, one of the nation’s bigger banks is searching for options to shore up its finances and calm jittery investors.

TITLE: First Republic and other U.S. Regional Banks Remain a Source of Worry
SUMMARY: Even as the stock price of Credit Suisse, the giant European lender, recovered after a plunge, shares of some midsize American banks plummeted on Thursday.

TITLE: Credit Suisse Shares Jump As Banking Backstops Go Global
SUMMARY: Credit Suisse secured a $54 billion lifeline from Switzerland’s central bank a day after the lender’s share price hit a record low.

TITLE: Yellen Says U.S. Banking System ‘Remains Sound’ Amid Market Turmoil
SUMMARY: The Treasury secretary also reassured Americans that their savings were safe.

TITLE: T-Mobile to Buy Ryan Reynolds’ Mint Mobile
SUMMARY: Mint Mobile, which launched in 2016, is known as a cheaper alternative to expensive mobile plans. The actor Ryan Reynolds purchased an ownership stake in the company in 2019.

TITLE: The European Central Bank Raises Rates Half a Percent Amid Uncertainty
SUMMARY: The E.C.B. was the first major central bank to set monetary policy since banking worries gripped financial markets.

TITLE: How ChatGPT and Generative AI Could Change the Way We Travel
SUMMARY: Powerful new artificial-intelligence software is already shaking up the travel industry, but it has a long way to go until it can plan a seamless trip. For now.

TITLE: Stocks drop again as worry about regional banks continues.
SUMMARY: Stocks on Wall Street dropped again, with shares of First Republic Bank and other regional lenders plunging.

TITLE: Credit Suisse to Borrow as Much as $54 Billion From Swiss Central Bank
SUMMARY: The Swiss lender had ended Wednesday fighting for its life, with shares at a record low and the cost to insure against a default the highest ever. The loan is an effort to avert further damage.

TITLE: TikTok Pushed by U.S. to Resolve National Security Concerns
SUMMARY: The demand hardens the White House’s stance toward the popular video app, which is owned by the Chinese internet company ByteDance.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs Draws Scrutiny Over Money Earned on Silicon Valley Bank Deal
SUMMARY: Goldman bought a bond portfolio on which the bank had booked a $1.8 billion loss, while also trying to raise capital for the bank in its last days.

TITLE: Stripe Raises New Funding That Values It at $50 Billion
SUMMARY: The payments processing start-up was valued at $95 billion in 2021, but private company dealmaking has been hurt by souring global economic conditions.

TITLE: No, Diversity Did Not Cause Silicon Valley Bank’s Collapse
SUMMARY: Blaming workplace diversity or environmentally and socially conscious investments for the firm’s downfall signals a “complete lack of understanding of how banks work,” one expert said.

TITLE: Silicon Valley Bank’s Assets Are for Sale, but No One Is Buying Yet
SUMMARY: Big rivals are thus far shying away from scooping up the bank’s assets.

TITLE: Wells Fargo’s Carrie Tolstedt Pleads Guilty and Faces Prison
SUMMARY: Carrie L. Tolstedt, who ran the bank’s retail branches, faces up to 16 months in prison for obstructing a bank examination.

TITLE: French Protesters Rally in Last Angry Push Before Pension Bill Vote
SUMMARY: Many believe the legislation to raise the retirement age to 64 from 62 will pass Parliament, and they are looking beyond the vote to fight on.

TITLE: Texas Judge Hears Case to End Federal Approval of Abortion Pill
SUMMARY: The judge said he would decide soon whether to issue a preliminary injunction ordering the F.D.A. to withdraw its approval of the drug or wait for the full trial.

TITLE: Richard Rosenberg, Who Rejuvenated Bank of America, Dies at 92
SUMMARY: As chief executive and chairman in the 1990s, he helped turn the bank into the nation’s second-largest through a series of acquisitions.

TITLE: U.S. Allows Canadian Pacific and Kansas City Southern Railroads to Merge
SUMMARY: Canadian Pacific’s acquisition of Kansas City Southern will create a railroad that links Canada, the United States and Mexico.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs Eyes a Big Payout From Silicon Valley Bank Deal
SUMMARY: The Wall Street giant is likely to be paid more than $100 million for its role in a bond purchase that ultimately failed to save the California bank from collapse.

TITLE: How Siri, Alexa and Google Assistant Lost the AI Race
SUMMARY: The virtual assistants had more than a decade to become indispensable. But they were hampered by clunky design and miscalculations, leaving room for chatbots to rise.

TITLE: A Hungarian Town Seethes Over a Giant Chinese Battery Plant
SUMMARY: A $7.8 billion factory planned by a Chinese company in eastern Hungary has become divisive even within the party of Prime Minister Viktor Orban, who championed it.

TITLE: Silicon Valley Bank Collapse: A Timeline of the Panic
SUMMARY: Silicon Valley Bank’s collapse led to the failure of a second bank and prompted regulators to move to contain the fallout in the U.S. banking system.

TITLE: Lawyers to Face Off Before Judge in Closely Watched Abortion Pills Case
SUMMARY: The first hearing in a lawsuit that seeks to overturn F.D.A. approval of the pills takes place Wednesday morning in Texas.

TITLE: Is This the New Cocktail Capital of Europe?
SUMMARY: Awash in small stylish watering holes where cocktails are tailored to customers’ tastes, Belgrade is quietly developing into one of the best bar destinations in Europe.

TITLE: Meet Tim Mayopoulos, the CEO of What Remains of Silicon Valley Bank
SUMMARY: The F.D.I.C. named Tim Mayopoulos as chief executive of Silicon Valley Bridge Bank. His job is to keep calm and carry on.

TITLE: Inside the Collapse of Silicon Valley Bank
SUMMARY: While its leader extolled innovation and the future of tech, the bank paid less attention to risk management and was caught flat-footed by economic change.

TITLE: How Washington Decided to Rescue Silicon Valley Bank’s Depositors
SUMMARY: Officials were initially unsure about the need for the measures they eventually announced to shore up the financial system, but changed their minds quickly.

TITLE: Volkswagen Will Invest $193 Billion in Electric Cars and Software
SUMMARY: The German automaker announced a plan to accelerate its transition to battery-powered vehicles and bolster operations in China and North America.

TITLE: Maxine Waters Says Congress Should Raise Cap on F.D.I.C. Backed Deposits
SUMMARY: Lawmakers should also revisit the 2018 rollback of regulations on midsize banks, Ms. Waters said in an interview.

TITLE: Wall Street rises on relief over banks and inflation.
SUMMARY: A rebound in bank stocks provided a pause in the market panic over the health of the financial system.

TITLE: OpenAI Unveils GPT-4, Months After ChatGPT Stunned Silicon Valley
SUMMARY: The company unveiled new technology called GPT-4 four months after its ChatGPT stunned Silicon Valley. The update is an improvement, but it carries some of the same baggage.

TITLE: AI Funding Frenzy Escalates
SUMMARY: In just weeks, a gold rush into artificial intelligence start-ups has become a full-blown mania.

TITLE: Novo Nordisk Says It Will Slash the Price of Insulin
SUMMARY: The company’s decision followed a similar move by its rival Eli Lilly this month.

TITLE: After Days of Panic, Midsize Banks See Stocks Rise
SUMMARY: Regional bank leaders offered jittery customers everything from a personal cellphone number to a video chat with Mitt Romney.

TITLE: U.S. Is Said to Open Investigation Into Silicon Valley Bank Collapse
SUMMARY: Legal experts said a focus of the investigation could be insider sales by several bank executives in the weeks before the bank’s failure.

TITLE: Stocks Rebound as Panic Appears to Pause
SUMMARY: Banking stocks that were hammered in the wake of the collapse of two midsize banks recovered on Tuesday as investor fears seemed to ease.

TITLE: Midsize banks have been at the center of recent turmoil.
Boeing Secures Big Order With Airlines in Saudi Arabia
SUMMARY: The order is the latest involving dozens of planes from airlines that are new or have plans to grow rapidly.

TITLE: Meta, Facebook’s Parent, to Lay Off Another 10,000 Workers
SUMMARY: It would be the tech company’s second round of cuts since November. Mark Zuckerberg, its chief executive, has declared 2023 the “year of efficiency.”

TITLE: Colleges Showcase Mass Timber, in Research and on Display
SUMMARY: Campuses across the nation are promoting the sustainable construction material as a low-carbon alternative to steel and concrete.

TITLE: Shares in First Republic and Others Rise After Federal Bank Rescue
SUMMARY: First Republic, Western Alliance and PacWest Bancorp shares were set to rise on Tuesday after one of the industry’s worst stock routs in years.

TITLE: Man Sues Buffalo Wild Wings Over ‘Boneless’ Wings
SUMMARY: The plaintiff claims the wing chain is falsely advertising its boneless wing products, which he says are more like chicken nuggets.

TITLE: Britain Wants Its Early Retirees Back, but Their Days Are ‘Never Boring’
SUMMARY: The country’s work force is smaller than it was before the pandemic, sapping economic potential. The government is going to try luring more people off the sidelines.

TITLE: Longing for Spring? A New Batch of Hotels Will Help You Celebrate It.
SUMMARY: Cherry blossoms in Tokyo, wildflowers in the Hudson Valley, breezy rooftop views in Paris: Here’s where to check in for a spring getaway.

TITLE: To Rein in China’s Banks, Xi Uses Familiar Playbook
SUMMARY: Xi Jinping is revamping China’s regulatory framework so the ruling Communist Party can assert more direct control over financial policy.

TITLE: Don’t Call It a Bailout: Washington Is Haunted by the 2008 Financial Crisis
SUMMARY: The colossal bailouts after the 2008 collapse arguably saved the global economy, but they also provoked a ferocious popular backlash.

TITLE: After Bank Debacle, Silicon Valley Reckons With Its Image
SUMMARY: Even as start-ups and investors began recovering their money from Silicon Valley Bank, the episode exposed the tech industry’s vulnerabilities.

TITLE: California Court Mostly Upholds Prop. 22 in Win for Uber and Other Gig Companies
SUMMARY: The decision lessens the chances that gig drivers will be considered employees in the state, but it is expected to be appealed to the state Supreme Court.
